alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 210 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains have developed over the metro areas of western Broward and Northwest Miami-Dade Counties. These heavy rains will be moving slowly to the northeast. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area during the next couple of hours. With the grounds being very saturated over the area, these rainfall amounts could cause some flooding issues. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Miami Gardens, Weston, Doral, Miami Lakes, Cooper City, Hialeah Gardens, Opa-Locka, Miami Springs, Medley, Palm Springs North, Country Club, Intersection I-75 And Griffin Road, Sunshine Acres and Intersection Krome And U.S. 27. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
